noun.description: A homogeneous noncrystalline substance consisting of large molecules or ultramicroscopic particles of one substance dispersed through a second substance. Colloids include gels, sols, and emulsions; the particles do not settle, and cannot be separated out by ordinary filtering or centrifuging like those in a suspension.

adjective.description: Of the nature relating to or characterized by a colloid or colloids.

origin: Mid 19th century: from Greek kolla glue + -oid.
